definition: puberty/period of development
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: The boy's voice is beginning to crack at the age of puberty.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩子的嗓音在發育期開始變得粗聲粗氣。

sentences.english: Junior students are in the period of physiological growth but psychological treason.
sentences.chinese: 初中生正處在生理的發育期，心理的叛逆期。

sentences.english: Sure enough, pubertal mice had seven times as many of the receptors as infant mice.
sentences.chinese: 果然，發育期的老鼠受體數量是幼小老鼠七倍。

sentences.english: Explain the effects of puberty and genetics.
sentences.chinese: 解釋發育期和基因的影響。

sentences.english: The pubertal mice, however, failed to learn to avoid it even after several rounds.
sentences.chinese: 然而，發育期老鼠在幾次逃竄之後卻未能知道迴避它。

sentences.english: Symptoms of spondylolisthesis often begin during the teen-age growth spurt.
sentences.chinese: 脊椎滑脫的症狀常起頭於青少年迅速發育期。
